title: Job Vacancies at Salpha Energy Limited
content:
Salpha Energy is a social, for-profit business that designs, distributes, solar-powered home energy products, with an underserved population in mind: the 1.3 billion global consumers for whom the old-fashioned electrical grid is either unavailable or too expensive.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

1.) 3D Product Designer - Consumer Electronics & Enclosure Design

Job Location: Lagos 
Employment Type: Contract

Job Description
     

        


     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	Salpha Energy is hiring a talented 3D Product Designer to support the development of consumer electronics enclosures.
	You’ll design functional, manufacturable, and visually compelling plastic housings for a variety of compact, performance-focused products.


Responsibilities


	Create detailed 3D CAD models for housings and small device enclosures.
	Develop technical drawings and documentation suitable for manufacturing and tooling vendors.
	Generate realistic product renderings for marketing, investor decks, and internal review.
	Support product integration by ensuring proper fit of internal components (PCBs, batteries, ports).
	Iterate on designs based on performance, assembly, and material feedback.
	Communicate effectively with cross-functional teams across design, manufacturing, and quality.


Requirements


	Candidates should possess an HND, B.Eng, or MSc with 5 - 9 years of experience. 
	Creative problem solver with technical rigor
	Detail-oriented and precise communicator.
	Comfortable working across design, engineering, and manufacturing teams.
	Excited about building innovative energy products for African markets


Required Skills & Tools:


	Proficiency in 3D design tools: SolidWorks, Fusion 360, AutoCAD, or similar.
	Experience with rendering software: KeyShot, Blender, V-Ray, or equivalent.
	Ability to prepare STL/STEP files, exploded views, and mold-ready component drawings.
	Strong understanding of plastic component design, DFM/DFA, and consumer product housings.
	Bonus: Experience working on electronics or plastic manufacturing.


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV and application to: salpha@salphaenergy.com using the Job Position as the subject of the email.

 

2.) Mechanical Engineer

Job Location: Calabar, Cross River 
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Description


	Salpha Energy is expanding its local manufacturing operations and is hiring a skilled
	Mechanical Engineer to establish and run our in-house plastic housing line.
	You’ll be responsible for setting up, optimizing, and scaling the injection molding process that produces durable enclosures.
	You’ll work at the intersection of mechanical performance and electronic integration, ensuring Salpha’s products meet the highestquality and efficiency standards.


Responsibilities


	Set up and manage injection molding machines and related tooling.
	Optimize cycle times, material flow, and machine parameters for consistent part quality.
	Troubleshoot molding defects (e.g., flash, short shots, warping, burns) and implement long-term fixes.
	Supervise mold maintenance, cleaning, and repair scheduling.
	Ensure product integration with electronic components (alignment, fit, cooling, cable access, etc.).
	Ensure safe, efficient workflows.


Requirements


	Bachelor’s Degree in Mechanical Engineering, Mechatronics, Polymer Engineering, or a related field.
	Minimum of 7 years of experience in injection molding, with proven success in high-volume plastic component production.
	Strong knowledge of polymer behavior, particularly Polypropylene (PP), Polyethylene (PE), and other housing-grade resins.
	Experience working with consumer electronics, small appliances, or energy products is highly preferred.
	Familiarity with ISO, GMP, or similar manufacturing standards is an advantage.


Technical Skills:


	Proficiency in injection machine setup, process validation, and root cause analysis.
	Strong understanding of hot runner and cooling systems, mold design, and machine electricals.
	Ability to document processes, analyze production data, and implement continuous improvement initiatives.


Soft Skills:


	Excellent team coordination and leadership ability.
	Sharp analytical mindset with a hands-on, solution-first attitude.
	Strong communication skills for cross-functional collaboration with engineering, QA, and logistics teams.


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV and Application to: salpha@salphaenergy.com using the Job Position as the subject of the email.

 


3.) Cashier/Inventory Officer, Kano

Job Location: Kano 
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Description


	As the Cashier / Inventory Officer, you will work closely with the location’s sales officers to facilitate customer purchasing, as well as handling and ensuring payments by the customer.
	You are saddled with the responsibility of handling stocks and inventory in the location of your operation by ensuring proper handling, receiving and documentation of the inventory received.
	You will be responsible for processing and receiving payments, issuing receipt and ensure proper documentation in the drive.


Key Responsibilities
Sales Transactions:


	Assist to achieve branch budgeted sales and profit target.
	Collecting payments for products either in cash or credit.
	Accepting payments, ensuring all prices and quantities are accurate and providing receipt for every sales transaction.
	Ensure products presented by customers are properly handled to the satisfaction of the customer.
	Receive and handling of the location’s inventories/Stock.
	Ensure accountability and safety of the location’s inventory.
	Ensure stock release only on approval of the Sales Order Form.
	Cross checking items presented for purchase by customers to see that they are in good condition.
	Track sales transactions and report any discrepancies to the management.
	Resolving customers’ complaints. Inventory Management:
	Ensure regular stock count at least twice in a month.
	Have proper knowledge of all companies’ products and prices.
	Escalate issues relating to inconsistencies in inventory to the financial accountant.


Cash Management:


	Make deposit of cash received to the bank.
	Daily reconciliations of cash and bank.
	Regular checks/phone calls to customers indebted to the company.


Record Keeping:


	Balancing the cash register and generating reports for credit and debit sales.
	Maintain accurate record of inventory sent to the station.
	Documenting sales, payments, and credits sales on the drive.
	Ensuring proper documentation of stocks and inventory issued out for sales.
	Keep proper record of cash and expenses within the location. Station Management:
	Maintain clean and tidy warehouse/storeroom and other equipment.
	Perform any other duties that may be assigned.


Qualifications


	Bachelor's Degree in Accounting / Business Administration / Economics or any relevant field with 3 - 5 years of experience
	Computer Savvy
	Excellent knowledge of Google Suites
	Excellent communication and interpersonal skills
	Prioritizing, time management and organizational skills
	Relationship management skills and openness to feedback
	Proven experience as a cashier is an added advantage.
	Candidates must reside in the job location.


Key Qualities Expected:
Appearance and Dressing:


	The Cashier/Inventory Officer will be clean and neatly attired while on duty in a manner befitting of your position.
	Teamwork – Ability to work within a diverse team with the aim of actualizing organizational goal above personal gains.
	An eye for details.
	Good knowledge of Inventory Management.
	Good communication and interpersonal skills.
	Ability to work effectively under pressure to meet deadlines.
	Result and service orientation.
	Ability to multi-task effectively.


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: careers@salphaenergy.com using the Job Position and Location as the subject of the mail.
